may be overridden by |credits=, which produces label "Notable credit(s)"; or by |works=, which produces label "Works"; or by |label_name=, which produces label "Label(s)" --> | style = [[Sheikh]]| home_town = | salary = | net_worth = <!-- Net worth should be supported with a citation from a reliable source --> | height = <!-- "X cm", "X m" or "X ft Y in" plus optional reference (conversions are automatic) --> | weight = <!-- "X kg", "X lb" or "X st Y lb" plus optional reference (conversions are automatic) --> | television = | title = <!-- Formal/awarded/job title. The parameter |office= may be used as an alternative when the label is better rendered as "Office" (e.g. public office or appointments) --> | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | movement = | opponents = | boards = | criminal_charge = <!-- Criminality parameters should be supported with citations from reliable sources --> | criminal_penalty = | criminal_status = | spouse = <!-- Use article title or common name --> | partner = <!-- (unmarried long-term partner) --> | children = | parents = <!-- overrides mother and father parameters --> | mother = <!-- may be used (optionally with father parameter) in place of parents parameter (displays "Parent(s)" as label) --> | father = <!-- may be used (optionally with mother parameter) in place of parents parameter (displays "Parent(s)" as label) --> | relatives = | family = | callsign = | awards = | website = <!-- {{URL|example.com}} --> | module = | module2 = | module3 = | module4 = | module5 = | module6 = | signature = | signature_size = | signature_alt = | footnotes = }} '''Sheikh Dr. Muhammad Abdul Rahman Obeid Abdulrahman Al Hammad''' ([[Arabic language|Arabic]]: '''الشيخ الدكتور محمد عبد الرحمن عبيد عبدالرحمن الحماد''') is a Saudi Arabian businessman, co-owner of [[Al Bayan Holding Group]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://archive.aawsat.com/details.asp?issueno=8800&article=150109#.W6JzwNDhXqD|title=شركة البيان القابضة تطرح استراتيجيات عمل لمؤسسات القطاع الخاص لتحقيق أهدافها,|website=archive.aawsat.com|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref>, Aloula Geojit and 20 other organizations in [[Saudi Arabia]] and the [[Gulf Cooperation Council]].
==Education== Al Hammad has pursued PhD and Masters degree in Business Administration in 2003<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.al-jazirah.com/2003/20030412/ec2s.htm|title=Al-jazirah|website=www.al-jazirah.com|access-date=2018-10-01}}</ref> from [[University of Brighton]], [[Brighton]], [[United Kingdom]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://dhow.com/biographies/52830516/mohamed-obaid-abdurrahman-alhammad/|title=Bios of prominent people and decision makers in Arabia|work=Dhow Net|access-date=2018-09-27|language=en-US}}</ref>.
==Business Career== ===Al Bayan Holding Group=== {{main|Al Bayan Holding Group}} Al Hammad is the co-owner with 24.5%<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.decypha.com/en/people-list/Abdulrahman-Al-Hammad-165148|title=Abdulrahman Obeid Abdulrahman Al Hammad {{!}} Saudi Arabia {{!}} Decypha|website=www.decypha.com|access-date=2018-09-21}}</ref> stake in [[Al Bayan Holding Group]], a conglomerate headquartered in [[Riyadh]], [[Saudi Arabia]] along with branched in [[Kuwait City]], [[Kuwait]].
==Vice Chairman of Saudi Cooperative Societies Council== In 2015, ''[[Saudi Gazette]]'' as well as ''[[Arab News]] ''informed that Al Hammad was appointed as the Vice Chairman of [[Cooperative Societies Council|Saudi Cooperative Societies Council]] on 22 November 2014<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.saudigazette.com.sa/article/145172|title=Al-Hammad urges creation of more Saudi cooperative societies|date=2015-12-24|work=Saudigazette|access-date=2018-09-18|language=en-GB}}</ref> by [[Saud Bin Salman bin Abdulaziz al Saud|Prince Saud bin Salman bin Abdulaziz al Saud]]. ==Comments== ===83rd Saudi National Day=== {{see|Saudi National Day}} ''[[Al Jazirah (newspaper)|Al Jazirah]]'' in 2013 published official statements of Dr Al Hammad on his praising of [[Saudi Arabia]], [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah Al Saud]] at the eve of 83rd Saudi National Day.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.al-jazirah.com/2013/20130924/ym159.htm|title=اليوم الوطني وحصاد المنجزات السنوي|website=www.al-jazirah.com|access-date=2018-09-27}}</ref> {{cquote|تهل علينا ذكرى اليوم الوطني كل عام كموسم سنوي يتكرر لحصاد المنجزات الشاملة في ربوع مملكتنا الحبيبة التي صار يوم إعلان تأسيسها عيدا ومناسبة للفرح.
وهذا العام يتعانق اليوم الوطني مع مرور 8 أعوام مجيدة منذ مبايعة سيدي خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله بن عبدالعزيز - حفظه الله - فقد امتدت مسيرة العطاء والإنجاز من لدن القائد الموحد الملك عبدالعزيز - طيب الله ثراه - مرورا بأبنائه الملوك الميامين حتى وصلت إلى خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبدالله فواصل العطاء والبناء بحدب الأب الرحيم على أبنائه وعم الخير في عهده الميمون كل أبناء الوطن.
ولكن ونحن في غمرة أفراحنا بمنجزات عام من عمر المملكة المديد ماذا علينا أن نتمثل وما هي الوقفة المطلوب منا أن نقفها أبناء المملكة مع أنفسنا ومع الوطن وأولياء أمره وهي وقفة أو وقفات تجعل من المناسبة فرصة للتأمل والمراجعة لا فرحة عابرة.
الوقفة الأولى مع التاريخ وهي لا بد أن نتذكر كيف كنا وكيف أصبحنا كيف كنا قبل قيام المملكة وتوحيدها قبائل متنافرة متناحرة لا يجمعها جامع تعيش شظف العيش وقسوة الحياة حتى منّ الله علينا بنعمة التوحيد التي امتن بها على أوائل هذه الأمة {وَاذْكُرُواْ نِعْمَةَ اللّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ كُنتُمْ أَعْدَاء فَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِكُمْ فَأَصْبَحْتُم بِنِعْمَتِهِ إِخْوَانًا} (103) سورة آل عمران، أجل كنا أعداء فأصبحنا بنعمة الله إخوانا ومن تمام شكر النعمة علينا ان نغرس في نفوس أبنائنا استشعار قيمة هذا المنجز العظيم وأهمية المحافظة عليه بصدق الانتماء والإخلاص بالولاء لهذا الوطن.
الوقفة الثانية بالطبع مع الإنجازات التي تتحقق على مختلف الأصعدة وفي شتى المجالات والميادين مما جعل المملكة مضرب الأمثال في التنمية وفي السياسة الحكيمة التي لا تثني المملكة من القيام بواجبها تجاه أمتها وقضايا العالم ولا تسمح لنفسها بالتدخل في شؤون الآخرين الأمر الذي أكسبها احتراما وبوأها مكانة دولية مرموقة ليس مبعث هذه المكانة قوة السلاح والتجبر لكن العقل والصدق واحترام الآخرين.
وبعيدا عن استعراض دور المملكة في إطار دول العشرين ومحافظتها الواعية على استقرار اقتصاد العالم المعتمد على النفط كطاقة حياتية يتوقف عليها نمو المجتمعات بعيدا عن كل ذلك نتوقف أمام التنمية المحلية المرتكزة على بناء الإنسان بالدرجة الأساسية لأنه هدف التنمية ووسيلتها معا ولذا اتجهت السياسة الحكيمة لخادم الحرمين الشريفين إلى بناء اقتصاد المعرفة الذي ينطلق أساسا من الاستثمار في الإنسان وإطلاق العقل المبدع فكان برنامج خادم الحرمين للابتعاث الخارجي مكملا لمؤسسات التعليم العملاقة والنموذجية من جامعات ومعاهد تعددت مستوياتها وامتدت لتشمل كل أرجاء الوطن.
ومن أوجه الاستثمار في الإنسان الصحة ويشهد العالم بمدى التطور الذي وصلت إليه المنشآت الصحية في المملكة وخدماتها المعتمدة أساساً على الكفاءات الوطنية السعودية من الأطباء والطبيبات الذين طبقت شهرتهم الآفاق وحققوا إنجازات عالمية تضاف إلى سجل العطاء الإنساني البشري في هذا المجال.
ووقفة أخرى في يومنا الوطني مع الوضع الذي تعيشه مملكتنا في هذه المرحلة الحرجة التي شهد العالم فيه من حولنا انعدام الأمن والاستقرار ونشوب الحروب والاضطرابات الداخلية التي تعاني من ويلاتها عدد من البلدان العربية وغير العربية ونحن ننعم بأمن واستقرار عظيمين يجب علينا إزاؤهما حمد الله أولا على هذه النعمة ثم الوفاء والولاء والالتفاف حول قيادتنا الحكيمة التي حمت الوطن والمواطن عبر سياسات قائمة على العدل الذي هو أساس الملك في كل المجالات وهو أمر نعض عليه بالنواجذ ونعلم أبنائنا والأجيال من بعدنا كيف يحافظوا عليه ويحمونه، والسعيد من اعتبر بغيره.
ويطول بنا الحديث في هذا المجال بعظمة المناسبة ولا نملك إلا أن ندعو الله أن يحفظ على هذه البلاد أمنها واستقرار ويوفق ولاة أمرها إلى ما فيه الخير وإلى الأمام يا موطن الخير عزيزاً مهاباً.}} [[English language|English]] translation: {{cquote|Every year, the National Day is celebrated every year as an annual season that is repeated in order to reap the comprehensive achievements of our beloved Kingdom, which on the day of its founding became a holiday and occasion for joy.
And this year embraces the national day with the passage of 8 glorious years since the allegiance of the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz - may God preserve him - has extended the process of giving and achievement of the unified leader King Abdulaziz - may God rest his soul - through his sons the kings of the Miamin until it reached the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques King Abdullah will continue to offer and build the father of the merciful to his children and the good deeds in his auspicious reign all the sons of the nation.
But we are in the midst of our joys with the general achievements of the long life of the Kingdom. What should we represent and what is the position that we are required to hold for the Kingdom's people with ourselves and with the nation and its guardians, a pause or pause that makes the occasion an opportunity to reflect and review?
The first stop with history and it is necessary to remember how we were and how we became how we were before the establishment of the Kingdom and unify rival tribes rivalry not collected by the living and the harsh living and cruelty of life even God to us the blessing of monotheism, which they entrusted to the early this nation {Remember the grace of God upon you as you (103) Surat Al-Imran, so we were enemies, we became by the grace of God our brothers and the full thanks of grace we have to instill in the hearts of our children the sense of the value of this great achievement and the importance of maintaining it honestly Belief and loyalty Loyalty to this country.
The second stop of course with the achievements achieved at various levels and in various fields and fields, which made the Kingdom a model of proverbs in development and wise policy that does not dissuade the Kingdom from performing its duty towards its nation and world issues and does not allow itself to interfere in the affairs of others, which earned them respect and prestige. The origin of this status is not the power of arms and coercion, but reason, honesty and respect for others.
Apart from reviewing the role of the Kingdom within the framework of the G-20 and its conscious preservation of the stability of the oil-dependent world economy as a life-force dependent on the growth of societies, we stop in front of local development based on building the human being mainly because it is the goal of development and its means together. Therefore, the prudent policy of the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques To build a knowledge economy that stems primarily from investment in human beings and the launch of the creative mind, the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques Program for External Scholarships complemented the huge and model educational institutions from universities and institutes of various levels, To the homeland.
The world is witnessing the development of health facilities in the Kingdom and its services mainly based on the Saudi national competencies of doctors and physicians who have applied their fame to the horizons and achieved international achievements in addition to the human humanitarian tender record in this field.
And another moment in our national day with the situation of our Kingdom at this critical stage in which the world around us the insecurity and stability and the outbreak of wars and internal strife, which suffer a number of Arab and non-Arab countries and we enjoy great security and stability, Grace, loyalty, loyalty and circumvention of our wise leadership, which protected the homeland and the citizen through policies based on justice, which is the basis of the king in all areas, which we bite by the people and we know our children and generations after us how to protect and protect him,
It is a long time for us to talk in this area of greatness of the occasion and we can only pray to God to preserve this country's security and stability and agree the governors of what is good and forward, the home of good dear. }}
===2009 Chinese President Hu Jintao's visit to Saudi Arabia=== Al Hammad also commented on the 2009 visit of the then [[People's Republic of China|Chinese]] [[Hu Jintao|President Hu Jintao]] to [[Saudi Arabia]] upon being invited by [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah Al Saud]]. His comments where published by ''[[Al Riyadh (newspaper)|Al Riyadh]]''<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.alriyadh.com/409517|title=الحماد يشيد بالنتائج الإيجابية لزيارة الرئيس الصيني للمملكة|work=جريدة الرياض|access-date=2018-09-27|language=ar}}</ref>: {{quote|إن الزيارة جاءت لتؤكد الأهمية الإستراتيجية للحفاظ على علاقات طويلة مع أكبر دولة مصدرة للنفط بالعالم بالنسبة لبكين المعتمدة على الواردات النفطية السعودية، وقال إن هذه الزيارة تدل دلالة واضحة بأهمية المملكة}} {{quote|The visit came to underscore the strategic importance of maintaining long-term relations with the world's largest oil exporter for Beijing, which relies on Saudi oil imports}} ===Turki Al Sudairi's election as Chairman of General Assembly of the Journalists' Council=== He also commented on Prince Turki Al Sudairi's election as Chairman of the General Assembly of the Journalists' Council in ''[[Al Riyadh (newspaper)|Al Riyadh]]'' in 2012<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.alriyadh.com/739069|title=لازلتم أهلاً وكفئاً لكل ثقة وتأكيد على تقدير الصحفيين لخبرتكم العريقة ومكانتكم المرموقة|work=جريدة الرياض|access-date=2018-09-27|language=ar}}</ref>, {{quote|سعادة الأخ الأستاذ تركي العبدالله السديري حفظه الله
السلام عليكم ورحمة الله وبركاته
إنه لمن دواعي سروري ان أتقدم لسعادتكم بأخلص التهاني وأصدق الأماني بمناسبة حصولكم على ثقة الجمعية العمومية لهيئة الصحافيين وانتخابكم (رئيساً لمجلس ادارة الهيئة للمرة الثالثة على التوالي) حيث كان ولايزال سعادتكم أهلاً وكفئا لكل ثقة لإعادة انتخابكم مما يؤكد تقدير الصحفيين السعوديين لما تتمتعون به من خبرة عريقة ومكانة مرموقة على مستوى الصحافة السعودية والخليجية والعربية.
وإذ اهنئ سعادتكم بهذه المناسبة فإنني أرفع إلى المولى عز وجل أكف الدعاء سائلاً إياه أن يوفق سعادتكم إلى ما يحبه ويرضاه وأن يمدكم بالعون ويسدد على طريق الحق والخير خطاكم.
وتفضلوا سعادتكم بقبول خالص الحب والتقدير والاحترام.
أخوكم ومحبكم
محمد الحماد
شركة مجموعة البيان القابضة
}} {{quote| His Excellency Mr. Turki Al-Abdullah Al-Sudairy, may God preserve him
Peace, mercy and blessings of God
It is my pleasure to extend to you my sincere congratulations and sincere wishes for your trust in the General Assembly of the Journalists' Council and for your election as Chairman of the Board for the third time in a row. Your Excellency is still welcome and efficient for any confidence in your re-election. This confirms the appreciation of Saudi journalists for your experience. And a prestigious position at the level of the Saudi, Gulf and Arabic press.
Congratulating Your Excellency on this occasion, I would like to extend my sincere thanks to the Almighty, asking him to reconcile Your Excellency to what He loves and desires, to provide you with help and to pay for your path.
Please accept your happiness to accept the sincere love, appreciation and respect.
Your brother and your lover
Mohamed Al Hammad
[[Al Bayan Holding Group|Al Bayan Holding Group Company]]
}}
===Prince Muqrin bin Abdul Aziz's appointment as Deputy Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia=== On May 27, 2014, [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah Al Saud]] appointed [[Muqrin bin Abdulaziz|Prince Muqrin bin Abdulaziz]] as the [[Deputy Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia]] in which Abdul Rahman Al Hammad commented on ''[[Okaz]]''<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.okaz.com.sa/article/925695/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%B1-%D9%85%D9%82%D8%B1%D9%86-%D8%B1%D8%AC%D9%84-%D8%AF%D9%88%D9%84%D8%A9-%D9%88%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%AD%D8%A8-%D9%85%D8%B3%D9%8A%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D9%88%D8%B9%D8%B7%D8%A7%D8%A1|title=الأمير مقرن رجل دولة وصاحب مسيرة وعطاء|date=2014-05-28|work=Okaz|access-date=2018-10-02|language=ar-GB}}</ref>: {{cquote| أتى المرسوم الملكي السامي بتعيين صاحب السمو الملكي الأمير مقرن بن عبد العزيز ولياً لولي العهد واستمراره نائباً ثانيا لرئيس مجلس الوزراء بمباركة وتأييد ورغبة صاحب السمو الملكي الأمير سلمان بن عبد العزيز ولي العهد وبموافقة أغلبية أعضاء هيئة البيعة ليؤكد على وحدة القيادة وعظمة الإرادة وقوة التلاحم الوطني قيادة وشعباً. كما أن هذا الاختيار لم يأت من فراغ حيث إن الأمير مقرن بن عبد العزيز من الشخصيات البارزة في كافة المجالات القيادية والسياسية والاقتصادية والعسكرية، حيث شغل العديد من المناصب بدءاً من عمله بالقوات الجوية الملكية السعودية ثم أميراً لمنطقة حائل لمدة تناهز 20 عاماً ثم أميراً لمنطقة المدينة المنورة ثم رئيساً للاستخبارات العامة لمدة سبع سنوات ثم مؤخراً مستشاراً ومبعوثاً خاصاً لخادم الحرمين الشريفين، ومن هذه المسيرة المتميزة يمكننا رؤية الخبرة والحنكة العظيمة والعلم والتواضع والإخلاص والكثير من الصفات التي يتميز بها الأمير مقرن بن عبد العزيز وأنه دوماً موضع ثقة القيادة في مملكتنا الحبيبة وسيكون له دور هام وحيوي في إدارة شؤون الوطن وعامل استقرار يرسخ مكانة المملكة ودورها الرائد في العالم أجمع.
محمد الحماد رئيس مجلس إدارة مجموعة البيان القابضة}} {{cquote|
Wednesday, May 28, 2014
The Supreme Royal Decree appoints His Royal Highness Prince Muqrin bin Abdul Aziz, Crown Prince and Deputy Prime Minister, with the blessing, support and desire of His Royal Highness Prince Salman bin Abdul Aziz, Crown Prince and with the approval of the majority of the members of the Allegiance Commission. And the people. Prince Muqrin bin Abdul Aziz is a prominent figure in all fields of leadership, political, economic and military. He held many positions, starting with his work with the Saudi Royal Air Force and then as Emir of Hail for nearly 20 years, And then the head of the General Intelligence for seven years and then recently adviser and special envoy to the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques, and from this distinguished march we can see the experience and great wisdom and science and humility and sincerity and many qualities that characterize Prince Muqrin bin Abdul Aziz and that The leadership position of trust in our beloved kingdom and will have an important and vital role in managing the affairs of the nation and thestability factor establishes the position of theKingdom and its leading role in the whole world.
Mohammed Al-Hammad, Chairman of Al-Bayan Holding Group
}}
==2017 Crisis== In March 2017, [[Malaysia|Malaysia's]] ''[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]'' reported that [[Malaysia|Malaysian]] [[RAM Holdings Berhad|RAM Rating Services]] of RAM Holdings Berhad, [[Kuala Lumpur]] suspended the rating of the RM1bil Sukuk Wakalah (2013/2023) issued by [[Al Bayan Holding Group|Al Bayan Holding Company]] following the group’s failure to meet certain obligations under RAM’s rating mandate. This resulted the escalation of [[Al Bayan Holding Group|Al Bayan's]] financial crisis<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2017/03/07/ram-ratings-suspends-rating-of-al-bayan-rm1b-sukuk/|title=RAM Ratings suspends rating of Al Bayan's RM1b Sukuk - Business News {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-09-18}}</ref>. {{quote|“We were unable to contact [[Al Bayan Holding Group|Al Bayan]] and seek a satisfactory resolution of outstanding matters.”
― RAM}}
After the suspension of RAM ratings, it was reported that many firms started to withdrew their contracts and agreements with [[Al Bayan Holding Group]], indicating that there is a financial crisis undergoing in [[Al Bayan Holding Group|Al Bayan]].
===2017 Anti-Corruption Drive=== It was reported that the [[Government of Saudi Arabia|Saudi government]] arrested co-owners of [[Al Bayan Holding Group]] in November 2017, including Dr. Abdul Rahman Al Hammad, following [[Muhammad bin Salman|Crown Prince Muhammad bin Salman's]] launch of [[2017 Saudi Arabian purge|2017 Anti-Corruption Drive]]. However, these suspicions and allegations didn't appeared in the local press of [[Saudi Arabia]].
===Social Media Outrage=== In December 2017, an Egyptian expatriate calling himself as an employee of [[Al Bayan Holding Group]] uploaded a video on YouTube where he explained about his mental harassment in the firm via the four co-owners. He also requested the arrest of co-owners and clearance of his dues through intervention of [[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman Al Saud]]<ref>{{Citation|last=Medhat Bogee|title=استغاثة العاملين بشركة مجموعة البيان القابضة بالرياض|date=2017-11-27|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LFPMCereqxI&feature=youtu.be|access-date=2018-09-18}}</ref>The same person uploaded a video in late December 2017 or early January 2018 where he records a footage through his mobile phone in which he shows a group of stranded employees of DNGO Contracting Company and Nahdaat Al Emaar, the two subsidiaries of [[Al Bayan Holding Group]] without their dues and salaries calling for justice<ref>{{Citation|last=Medhat Bogee|title=تكملة للاستغاثة للعاملين بشركة مجموعة البيان القابضة دونجو ونهضة الاعمار للمقاولات|date=2017-11-28|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oTP92l44gsI&feature=youtu.be|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref>.
In early January 2017, an person informing himself as an engineer assigned at [[Al Bayan Holding Group]] recorded a footage via his mobile phone and later uploaded it on [[YouTube]]. In the video, he had shown that employees holding banners are on strike against the firm as some of them didn't receive their dues and salaries from the past 13 months<ref>{{Citation|last=Engr.Sherief.Ahmed|title=اعتصام موظفين مجموعة البيان القابضة بادارة الشركة بالعليا والشركة تطلب الشرطة للموظفين|date=2018-01-09|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=youtu.be&v=cCq1BJq1THg&app=desktop|access-date=2018-09-18}}</ref>. The same engineer uploaded a video in the same month of January where he shows stranded expatriates who didn't received their salaries for more than six months on strike against the firm at the [[Al Bayan Holding Group|Al Bayan's]] project site in [['Asir Region]]<ref>{{Citation|last=Engr.Sherief.Ahmed|title=اعتصام عمال مجموعة البيان القابضة مشاريع عسير|date=2018-01-09|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmqBYoqoR5M|access-date=2018-09-21}}</ref>.
An another expatriate in [[Al Bayan Holding Group]] uploaded a video on YouTube in February 2018 requesting justice from [[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman Al Saud]] and [[Muhammad bin Salman|Crown Prince Muhammad bin Salman Al Saud]] after he didn't received his salary for more than 12 months<ref>{{Citation|last=hamada Mostafa|title=مجموعه البيان القابضه للمقاولات وتأخر رواتب سنه كامله|date=2018-02-03|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytAbDfOMuso&feature=youtu.be|access-date=2018-09-18}}</ref>.
==See Also== *[[Al Bayan Holding Group]] *[[2017 Saudi Arabian purge]] [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Saudi Arabian businesspeople]]

revision.text:
Baron '''Adolf Kohner''' Szaszberek ([[Budapest]], April 26, 1866; Budapest, January 30, 1937) was a Hungarian businessman, landowner and a leading member of the Jewish community in that country.
==Life==
In 1874 Baron Kohner founded ''Adolf Kohner and Sons'', a private bank. Through his efforts as manager and director, the bank grew to become one of the largest private banks in Hungary. In addition to being a leading figure in Hungarian financial circles, Kohner was also one of the country’s most well educated large landowner and industrialist. His range of interests and knowledge was widespread, ranging from mechanical engineering to agricultural science. He was a significant figure in the Hungarian Jewish community and served as president of the ''Jewish Communities Federation'' in Hungary.<ref>[http://www.jta.org/1928/05/07/archive/adolph-kohner-heads-jewish-communities-federation-in-hungary Adolf Kohner Heads Jewish Communities Federation in Hungary] JTA - May 7, 1928</ref>
==Art Collector==
Baron Kohner was famous for his role as an art collector and patron of the arts in Hungary. In 1902 he became president of the ''Hungarian National Art Association''. In the same year he founded the artists’ colony in [[Szolnok]],<ref>Budapest, 1890-1919: l'anima e le forme. Casa editrice Electa 1981</ref> Hungary. His private collection was focused on the paintings of the French impressionistic and post-impressionistic periods. Among the artists represented in his collection were [[Théodore Géricault]], [[Eugène Delacroix]], [[Honoré Daumier]], painters of the [[Barbizon school]] such as [[Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot]], [[Jean-François Millet]], Antoine Chintreuil, [[Gustave Courbet]], [[Édouard Manet]], [[Berthe Morisot]], [[Claude Monet]], [[Pierre-Auguste Renoir]], [[Paul Cézanne]], [[Alfred Sisley]], [[Paul Gauguin]] and [[Pierre Puvis de Chavannes]]. The collection also included works from other periods such as Nuns” by [[Alessandro Magnasco]] and several paintings by [[John Constable]] and [[Francisco Goya]]. Leading Hungarian artists were also represented in his collection. These included Meszoly Geza, Laszlo Paal and [[Mihály Munkácsy]] and painters of the Hungarian artists' colonies Nagybanya and Szolnok. Many of the paintings were subsequently donated by Kohner to the Art Gallery of the National Museum of Hungary.
==Salotto Kohner==
Kohner used the earnings from his banking and other businesses to buy an estate of 28.000 acres near Szolnok, Hungary, with the goal of transforming it into a model farm and university study center. Professors and students from the Agrarian University of Budapest used this land as an experimental laboratory and it ultimately became one of the most avant-garde farming system of all time.<ref>Alessandra Farkas: ''Pranzo di Famiglia'', Sperling&Kupfer Editori, 2006 {{ISBN|88-200-4059-X}}</ref> Kohner was also a talented musician. He plays the cello and had a vast collection of Stradivarius and Guarneri violins. Among his closest friends were many famous musicians including [[Franz Liszt]], [[Giacomo Puccini]] and [[Béla Bartók]].<ref>Alessandra Farkas: ''Pranzo di Famiglia'', Sperling&Kupfer Editori, 2006 {{ISBN|88-200-4059-X}}</ref>
==Béla Bartók supporter==
Kohner was a major benefactor of Hungarian composer Béla Bartók, providing him with an annual stipend for many years that enabled Bartók to travel throughout Hungary and assemble a collection of ancient Hungarian folk songs. In his memoirs Bartók recalled the help Kohner offered him in 1905 and he stated: "''... he wanted me to understand that I could turn to him with confidence in case I needed money. He would be willing to help me from time to time. . It’s so kind of Kohner to be interested in my life ..''".<ref>Budapest, 1890-1919: l'anima e le forme. Casa editrice Electa 1981</ref> Bartók also evoked the two weeks he spent in 1918 at Kohner’s castle in the Hungarian countryside: "''The house was just like a hotel where guests would come and go. The home library was full of manuscripts... People talked about many topics: music, literature, Jewish issues, religion, Bolshevik movement, manufacturing, trade. Mr. Baron is familiar with music, he plays the violin ... he is a close friend of some painters (the Kohner family loves [[Adolf Fényes]] very much. He was there for few days), one of his daughters is a painter as well and she is studying at Fényes’, the other one goes to university''".
==Businessman==
At the beginning of the twentieth century, Kohner was considered one of the richest men of the Hungarian-Jewish upper class. In addition to his success as a banker, he played a prominent role in the textile, food and chemical industries of Hungary. He was also a large landowner and, with his sons, developed a successful livestock farming business and canning company.
==Social Role==
As a leading figure of the Hungarian-Jewish upper class, Kohner was a prominent social figure in the larger Hungarian community. The most important recognition of his role was the 1912 decision of Emperor [[Franz Joseph I of Austria]] to name Kohner a Baron and Court Counselor.
==Last Years of Life==
In the early 1930s Kohner unsuccessfully engaged in financial speculation which had negative effects on his businesses and ultimately dragged him to the brink of bankruptcy in 1933. The following year he was forced to auction most of his art collection in order to pay off his debts. Later, he was also obliged to sell his castle and many other real estate holdings. Upon his death in 1937, his obituary, appearing in the journal Past and Future, stated that, despite the financial collapse that forced him to a retired life, ''Kohner had endured with dignity finding solace in his beloved books''.
Kohner died on January 30th 1937 and he was buried on February 2 in the Jewish cemetery in Salgotarjan. He left four children: Karoly, Ida, wife of the painter [[István Farkas (painter)|István Farkas]], Lujza, Katalin.
== Notes == <references/>
== Literature == * [[Alessandra Farkas]]: ''Pranzo di Famiglia'', Sperling&Kupfer Editori, 2006 {{ISBN|88-200-4059-X}}. * Vámos Éva Katalin: Egy vegyész gyáros mint a művészetek mecénása. In: ''Tanulmányok a természettudományok, a technika és az orvoslás történetéből''. Bp.: MTESZ, 1996. 39-43. p. *[http://www.adnkronos.com/Archivio/AdnAgenzia/2006/07/22/Cultura/Libri/NOTIZIARIO-NOVITA-EDITORIALI-3_061614.php La storia della famiglia Farkas. Il talento e la cultura di una famiglia ungherese] Adnkronos - 22 luglio 2006. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090622135039/http://www.mazsike.hu/mugyujto+es+a+kemia+doktora+%E2%80%93+dr+kohner+adolf+baro.html MAZSIKE - Magyar Zsidó Nagyjaink]
==Related pages==
*[[Béla Bartók]] *[[István Farkas (painter)|István Farkas]] *[[Alessandra Farkas]]

{{about||the surname|Alcón|other uses}} {{Infobox company | name = Alcon | logo = Logo Alcon.svg | logo_size = 250px | type = [[Subsidiary]] of [[Novartis]] | foundation = [[Fort Worth, Texas]], United States (1945) | location = [[Geneva]], [[Switzerland]] (Global HQ) [[Fribourg]], [[Switzerland]] (Incorporated) | key_people = | industry = [[Ophthalmology]] | products = [[Surgical equipment|Surgical products]]
[[Contact lens|Contact lenses]]
[[Over-the-counter drug|Over-the-counter products]] | revenue = {{profit}} $7 billion [[United States dollar|USD]] (2017) {{cite web|url=https://www.alcon.com/content/new-alcon|title=Novartis announces intention to seek shareholder approval for 100% spinoff of Alcon eye care devices business|work=Alcon}} | num_employees = 20,000+ (2017) | homepage = {{URL|http://www.alcon.com}} }} [[File:11460 Johns Creek Pkwy, Johns Creek, GA Nov 2017.jpg|thumb|Alcon offices in [[Johns Creek, Georgia]]]] '''Alcon''' is swiss global [[medical]] company specializing in eye care products and headquartered in [[Geneva]], [[Switzerland]]. Alcon's American headquarters are located in [[Fort Worth, Texas]]. Alcon is a subsidiary of [[Novartis]] although the company announced intention to seek shareholder approval for 100% spinoff of Alcon eye care devices business in order to create an independent company in 2019.{{cite web|url=https://www.alcon.com/content/new-alcon|title=Novartis announces intention to seek shareholder approval for 100% spinoff of Alcon eye care devices business|work=Alcon}} == History == Alcon was founded in 1945{{cite web|url=https://www.alcon.com/about-us/who-we-are/history|title= Improving Vision through Innovation Since 1945}} in [[Fort Worth, Texas]], USA. The company started as a small [[pharmacy]] in Fort Worth and was named for its founders, [[pharmacist]]s Robert Alexander and William Conner. Conner and Alexander focused on [[sterilization (microbiology)|sterile]] [[Ophthalmology|ophthalmic]] products. [[Nestlé]] of [[Switzerland]] purchased Alcon in 1977. Alcon expanded its manufacturing capability with new plants in South America and Europe and drastically increased its investment in research. In 1979, Alcon acquired Texas Pharmacal Company which became Dermatological Products of Texas (and is now [[DPT Laboratories]]). In 1984, Alcon founded the Technical Excellence Award to promote achievements in R&D excellence and has awarded it to more than 100 recipients. The Alcon product line has expanded from [[pharmaceuticals]] to the surgical arena. Today, Alcon has operations in 75 countries and their products are sold in over 180 countries. [[Nestlé]] conducted an initial public offering of 25% of its stake in Alcon in 2002. The stock is traded under the [[ticker symbol]] ACL. In July 2008, Novartis purchased approximately 25% of Nestlé's stake in Alcon, with an option to buy Nestlé's remaining shares beginning in 2010.[http://links.reuters.com/r/SCXS8/P81DY/JIQCHE/H9SK4/IOW2A/YT/h Reuters - Novartis announces offer to buy Nestlé's shares in Alcon] {{dead link|date=June 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} Novartis bought 52% stake from Nestlé for $28.1 Billion. This deal brought the total ownership of Novartis to 77%. Beginning January 2010 Novartis formally announced it will be completing the exercise options for finishing purchasing the rest of Alcon and then promptly continue to exercise merger and takeover of Alcon.{{cite web|url=https://www.alcon.com/content/new-alcon|title=Novartis announces intention to seek shareholder approval for 100% spinoff of Alcon eye care devices business|work=Scribd}} On March 29, 2010, Alcon acquired Durezol and Zyclorin from Sirion Therapeutics. Alcon received regulatory approval to acquire the rights of Durezol emulsion in the US and the global rights, excluding Latin America, for Zyclorin from Sirion Therapeutics.{{cite web|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20100329006744/en/Alcon-Completes-Acquisition-DUREZOL%E2%84%A2-ZYCLORIN%E2%84%A2-Sirion|title=Alcon Completes Acquisition of DUREZOL™ and ZYCLORIN™ from Sirion|date=March 29, 2010|access-date=March 16, 2016|publisher=[[Business Wire]]}} On June 28, 2010, Alcon's Independent Director Committee announced that a recommendation by the Committee was an indispensable first step before the board of the company can decide on the merger proposal of [[Novartis AG]], refuted Novartis’ public implications that it would be able to unilaterally impose the merger irrespective of the Independent Director Committee’s position once Novartis became Alcon’s majority shareholder. On July 8, 2010, Alcon's independent director committee (IDC) had set up a $50 million litigation trust to ensure company's minority shareholders get the best deal from bidder Novartis AG.{{cite web|url=http://ceoworld.biz/ceo/2010/07/08/alcon-acl-sets-up-trust-for-litigation-between-with-novartis-to-protect-minorities |title=Alcon (ACL) Sets up trust for litigation between with Novartis to protect minorities |work=The Chief Executive Forum |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100710193111/http://ceoworld.biz/ceo/2010/07/08/alcon-acl-sets-up-trust-for-litigation-between-with-novartis-to-protect-minorities |archivedate=2010-07-10 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Alcon}} *[http://www.alcon.com/ Alcon Official Website] *[https://www.scribd.com/doc/24764035/Novartis-exercises-option-and-proposes-merger/ Alcon : Novartis exercises option and proposes merger] *[http://www.optix-now.com/ Optix-now: Contact lens guide with independent product information for consumers covering Alcon and other major manufacturers] *[https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSLDE65R0EZ20100628/ Novartis needs Alcon directors' OK for buyout] *[http://www.transactioninfo.com/alcon/docs/Alcon_Release_6_28_10.pdf/ Swiss Corporate Governance Expert Supports Alcon Independent Director Committee’s Position against Novartis]{{dead link|date=March 2015}} {{Pharmaceutical companies of the United States}} [[Category:Companies based in Fort Worth, Texas]] [[Category:Companies of Switzerland]] [[Category:Multinational companies]] [[Category:Contact lenses]] [[Category:Pharmaceutical companies of the United States]] [[Category:Companies formerly listed on the New York Stock Exchange]] [[Category:Life sciences industry]] [[Category:Health care companies based in Texas]] [[Category:Eyewear companies of the United States]] [[Category:Medical and health organisations based in Switzerland]] [[Category:Novartis]]

{{Infobox politician | name = Ali Haji Warsame
علي حاج ورسمه | image = | imagesize = | birth_date = 1964 | birth_place = Seemade, [[Mudug]], [[Somalia]] | office = Minister of Education of [[Puntland]] | term_start = 28 January 2014 | term_end = | vicepresident = [[Abdihakim Abdullahi Haji Omar]] | primeminister = | predecessor = Abdi Farah Saeed | successor = | office2 = | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | primeminister2 = | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | office3 = | term_start3 = | term_end3 = | primeminister3 = | predecessor3 = | successor3 = | party = | alma_mater = Somali Institute for Development, Administration and Management
[[American University in London]] | religion = [[Islam]], Suni }} '''Ali Haji Warsame''' ({{lang-so|Cali Xaaji Warsame}}, {{lang-ar|علي حاج ورسمه}}) is a [[Somali people|Somali]] entrepreneur, accountant, professor and politician. He served as the first Director of Management at the [[Port of Bosaso]], and later as the Chief Executive Officer of [[Golis Telecom Somalia]]. In 2014, he was appointed the Minister of Education of [[Puntland]]. ==Personal life== Warsame was born in 1964 in Seemada, a village near the [[Jariban District]] in the [[Mudug]] province of the autonomous [[Puntland]] state in northeastern [[Somalia]]. His late father was a lawyer, judge, politician, intellectual, and community and religious leader who was part of the local independence movement in the 1940s and 1950s. His mother hails from the northern [[Sool, Somalia|Sool]] province.{{cite web|title=Soo-yaalkiisa Taariikheed ee Cali |url=http://www.alihajiwarsame.com/Biography.pdf |publisher=Ali Haji Warsame |accessdate=3 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140103172721/http://www.alihajiwarsame.com/Biography.pdf |archivedate=January 3, 2014 }} Warsame belongs to the [[Majeerteen]] [[Harti (Darod)|Harti]] [[Darod]] clan.{{cite news|title=WAXGARADKA BAHARARSAME / DHULBAHANTE & CUMAR MAXAMUD / MAJEERTEEN EE GALBEEDKA LONDON, UK|url=http://www.waayaha.net/view.php?articleid=10472|accessdate=3 January 2014|newspaper=Waayaha|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104115323/http://www.waayaha.net/view.php?articleid=10472|archive-date=2014-01-04|dead-url=yes|df=}} He began school in the northwestern town of [[Hargeisa]], the second largest city in Somalia. Warsame completed his primary education in the Mudug province capital of [[Galkayo]]. He subsequently studied at the Somali Institute for Development, Administration and Management (SIDAM), earning a bachelor's degree in business management and administration in 1990. In 2003, he received an MBA in management information systems from the [[American University in London]]. Besides Somalia, Warsame has lived and worked in various countries, including the [[United Arab Emirates]] and the [[United Kingdom]]. He is also fluent in a number of languages, notably [[Somali language|Somali]], [[Arabic language|Arabic]] and [[English language|English]]. ==Career== ===Early career=== Professionally, Warsame is a successful entrepreneur. He has extensive knowledge and work experience in auditing, accounting and public financial management. He started his career as a Financial and Administrative Controller for Man and Brothers, a private firm in the water facility installation industry. When the [[Somali Civil War|civil war]] broke out in Somalia in 1991, Warsame relocated to the northern regions of [[Puntland]] where he spent more years. Warsame later moved to the UAE. He held managerial positions in various local institutions. Between June 1991 to March 2012, he was a Senior Consultant/Partner at Falcon Associates Limited. He also served as an Auditor/Senior-in-charge at the [[Abu Dhabi]] Accountability Authority, as a Financial Controller at the UAE Ministry of Education-affiliated Abu Dhabi Educational Zone, and as a Senior Auditor at Al-Radhwan Accounting and Auditing. Warsame likewise acted as a Senior Accountant at the Pistache Trading Co. LLC. From 2001 and 2003, Warsame began lecturing at a number of educational institutions in the United Arab Emirates. He taught accounting, business law, reporting, financial accounting and auditing at the Abu Dhabi Audit Authority. He also served as an instructor on accounting and accounting software applications at the Somali Cultural Foundation and Hatta Computers Company in [[Dubai]]. In 2012, Warsame returned to Somalia, becoming the Chief Executive Officer of [[Golis Telecom Somalia|Golis Telecom]]. Among the largest telecommunications companies in the country, it had 41 branches and 141 centers across the Puntland, Somaliland and Galmudug regions in 2013. Warsame worked at the firm from May 2012 to October 2013, and was responsible for overseeing managerial and financial activities, formulating administrative policies and procedures, adhering to the operational budget and financial guidelines, and liaising with all of the company's divisions, departments, sections and sub-sections. In 2013, Warsame presented himself as a candidate in the [[Puntland presidential election, 2014|2014 Puntland presidential elections]], which took place on 8 January 2014 in [[Garowe]]. He received the endorsement of former Puntland Interim Vice President Mohamed Ali Yusuf "Gaagaab", who dropped out of the race on 2 January 2014.{{cite news|title=Somalia: Opposition candidate relinquishes candidacy for Puntland President|url=http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia-Opposition-candidate-relinquishes-candidacy-for-Puntland-president_printer.shtml|accessdate=3 January 2014|newspaper=Garowe Online|date=2 January 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140103222910/http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia-Opposition-candidate-relinquishes-candidacy-for-Puntland-president_printer.shtml|archive-date=2014-01-03|dead-url=yes|df=}} The first round of voting saw 8 of the 11 presidential contenders eliminated from the running. Ali H. Warsame, incumbent Puntland President [[Abdirahman Mohamud Farole]] and former Prime Minister of Somalia [[Abdiweli Mohamed Ali]] subsequently moved on to the second round, where Warsame was eliminated. He received 16 votes versus 18 for Ali and 31 for Farole, with Ali eventually winning the ballot.{{cite news|title=Somalia: Parliament elects Dr. Abdiweli Gaas as new Puntland President |url=http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia-Parliament-elects-Dr-Abdiweli-Gaas-as-new-Puntland-President_printer.shtml |accessdate=8 January 2014 |newspaper=Garowe Online |date=8 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140108194743/http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia-Parliament-elects-Dr-Abdiweli-Gaas-as-new-Puntland-President_printer.shtml |archivedate=8 January 2014 }} ===Minister of Education=== On 28 January 2014, Warsame was appointed Puntland's Minister of Education by the region's new President Abdiweli Mohamed Ali.{{cite news|title=Somalia: Puntland leader unveils new cabinet |url=http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia-Puntland-leader-unveils-new-cabinet_printer.shtml |accessdate=29 January 2014 |newspaper=Garowe Online |date=28 January 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219073917/http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia-Puntland-leader-unveils-new-cabinet_printer.shtml |archivedate=19 February 2014 |df= }} ==Philanthropy== Besides business and politics, Warsame is also involved in a number of philanthropic endeavours. He is a contributor to various charity organizations in Somalia and elsewhere. He also provides basic training services to youth and adult learners in the Puntland region. Additionally, Warsame is a trustee of the UK-based MURDA charity, which offers training and educational programs overseas. ==Professional memberships== Warsame is a member of a number of professional organizations: *Certified Public Accountant (CPA) *Member of the Somali Association of Certified Accountants *Member of American Institute of Certified Public Accountants and Licenced Auditor from Delaware State Board of Accountancy *Certified Accounting Technician *Assessor from City & Guilds, UK. ==See also== *[[Abdulkadir Abdi Hashi]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Warsame, Ali Haji}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Ethnic Somali people]] [[Category:Somalian businesspeople]] [[Category:Somalian Muslims]]

The '''annual business survey''', formerly the '''annual business inquiry''', is a [[census of production]] in the United Kingdom, produced by the [[Office for National Statistics]]. It was introduced in 1988 and consolidated earlier surveys. Results were first published in 2000.
==External links== *[http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/surveys/respondents/business/a-z-of-business-surveys/annual-business-survey/index.html Office for National Statistics: Annual Business Survey: Survey at a glance] *[http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/method-quality/specific/business-and-energy/annual-business-survey/abs-news/index.html Office for National Statistics: Annual Business Survey: ABS News]
[[Category:Economy of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Business in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:1988 introductions]] [[Category:Surveys]]
{{business-stub}} {{UK-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2012}} {{Use British English|date=July 2012}}
'''Arthur Joseph Munby''' (19 August 1828 – 29 January 1910) was a British [[diarist]], [[poetry|poet]], portrait photographer, [[barrister]] and [[solicitor]]. He is also known by his initials, '''A. J. Munby'''.
==Biography== Arthur Munby was born in [[York]]. He was educated at [[Trinity College, Cambridge]], graduating with a BA in 1851, and was [[called to the Bar]] from [[Lincoln's Inn]] in 1855.<ref>{{acad|id=MNBY847AJ|name=Munby, Arthur James}}</ref> He worked as a civil servant in the [[Ecclesiastical Commissioners]]' office from 1858 until his retirement in 1888. His published poetry included ''Benoni'' (1852) and ''Verses New and Old'' (1865). He taught [[Latin]] at the [[Working Men's College]] for more than a decade and helped promote the Working Men's College Volunteer Corps, a response to the national call for Volunteer Rifle Corps (1859) to combat a perceived threat from Napoleon the Third. Munby penned verses of support, the ''Invicta: a Song of 1860'', for the 19th [[Middlesex Regiment]], a regiment to which the W.M.C.V.C. was attached.<ref name=Harrison>[[J. F. C. Harrison|Harrison, J. F. C.]] ,''A History of the Working Men's College (1854-1954)''. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1954</ref> In 1864, a sister Working Women's College was established; Munby was a leading spirit of, and teacher at, the new college.<ref name="Harrison"/>
Munby had a lifelong fascination with working-class women, particularly those who did hard physical labour. His favourite pastime was wandering the streets of London and other industrial cities where he approached working women to ask about their lives and the details of their work, while noting their clothes and [[dialect]]s. The observations were recorded in his journals.
He was an amateur artist, and his diaries contain sketches of working women. He collected hundreds of photographs of [[Pit brow women|women who worked at collieries]], kitchen maids, milkmaids, charwomen, acrobats and so on. His diaries and images provide historical information on the lives of working-class Victorian women. Much of his obsession is hinted at in his last book, ''Faithful Servants: being epitaphs and obituaries recording their names and services'' (1891).
His papers are housed at [[Trinity College, Cambridge]], there is a list of his papers on the Cambridge Janus website<ref name="Munby papers">{{cite web|title=Trinity College Library Cambridge: MUNB|url=http://janus.lib.cam.ac.uk/db/node.xsp?id=EAD%2FGBR%2F0016%2FMUNB}}</ref>
=== Hannah Cullwick === In 1854, while on one of his urban wanderings, Munby met [[Hannah Cullwick]], a Shropshire-born maid-of-all-work. They formed a relationship in which Munby was the master and Cullwick the slave, with him training her in the virtues of hard work and loyalty. His scenarios included elements of [[ageplay]] and [[paraphilic infantilism|infantilism]], with Cullwick holding him in her lap or carrying him.
They married secretly in 1873 but Cullwick resisted his efforts to make her into a lady and she lived with him as a domestic servant, not a wife. She played the role of a lady wife on trips to Europe. They separated in 1877, but continued to see each other until Cullwick's death in 1909. The marriage was secret from all but a few close friends; he revealed it to his brother only a few months before his own death from [[pneumonia]].
== References == {{Reflist}}
== Further reading ==
* Judith Flanders. ''Inside the Victorian Home: A Portrait of Domestic Life in Victorian England''. New York: W. W. Norton, 2004. * [[Diane Atkinson]]. ''Love and Dirt: The Marriage of Arthur Munby and Hannah Cullwick''. New York: Macmillan, 2003. * Barry Reay. ''Watching Hannah: Sexuality, Horror and Bodily De-formation in Victorian England''. Reaktion, 2002. ({{ISBN|1-86189-119-9}}) * Anne McClintock, ''Imperial Leather: Race, Gender, and Sex in the Colonial Contest''. New York: Routledge, 1995. ({{ISBN|0-415-90890-6}}) * Derek Hudson. ''Munby: Man of Two Worlds''. Gambit, 1972. ({{ISBN|0-87645-066-4}}) * Michael Hiley ''Victorian Working Women: Portraits from Life''. Gordon Fraser, 1979 ({{ISBN|978-0-86092-033-5}})
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Munby, Arthur}} [[Category:Portrait photographers]] [[Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Cambridge]] [[Category:English diarists]] [[Category:English educational theorists]] [[Category:English civil servants]] [[Category:English barristers]] [[Category:English solicitors]] [[Category:1828 births]] [[Category:1910 deaths]] [[Category:British diarists]] [[Category:Industrial history]] [[Category:English male poets]] [[Category:English male non-fiction writers]]
