{{Refimprove|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox non-profit | Non-profit_name = National Association of Corporate Directors | Non-profit_logo = | Non-profit_type = National Director Membership Organization | founded_date = {{start date and age|1977|12|19}} | founder = | location = 1515 N. Courthouse Road, Suite 1200
[[Arlington, VA]], [[United States|U.S.]] | origins = | key_people = [[Reatha King|Reatha Clark King]], [[Barbara Hackman Franklin]] | area_served = Nationwide | focus = Director Education, Board Development, Director Recruitment Services, Credentialing | method = Public, Private and Nonprofit Company Surveys, Educational Events, Conferences, Publications | revenue = | endowment = | num_volunteers = | num_employees = | num_members = 20,000 | owner = | Non-profit_slogan = | homepage = {{URL|http://www.nacdonline.org/}} | dissolved = | footnotes = }} The '''National Association of Corporate Directors''' ('''NACD''') is an independent, not-for-profit, section [[501(c)(3)]] founded in 1977 and headquartered just outside of [[Washington, DC]], in [[Arlington, VA]]. NACD’s membership includes the entire boards of 1,250 corporations as well as several thousand individual members, for a total of more than 20,000 members. Membership is open to individuals serving on boards of public, private, and nonprofit organizations from both the United States and overseas.{{cite web|url=https://www.nacdonline.org/Membership/?navItemNumber=567|title=NACD - Why Join? - NACD Membership|website=Nacdonline.org|accessdate=10 July 2017}} The organization is registered with the [[National Association of State Boards of Accountancy]] as a sponsor of continuing professional education on the National Registry of CPE Sponsors.{{cite web | publisher = Learning Market | url =http://www.learningmarket.org/page.cfm/Action=Exhib/ExhibID=1314 | title = National Association of Corporate Directors Company Profile |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} NACD operates at both a national and local level, with 22 chapters in major metropolitan cities across the United States providing educational programs and networking opportunities. The organization collaborates with various other organizations such as Heidrick & Struggles, KPMG’s Audit Committee Institute, Marsh & McLennan Companies, Pearl Meyer & Partners, and Sidley Austin.{{cite web | publisher = Forbes | url =https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucerogers/2012/05/15/top-companies-reluctant-to-increase-director-compensation-according-to-new-study-from-national-association-of-corporate-boards/ | title = Top Companies Reluctant to Increase Director Compensation |accessdate = May 5, 2012}} ==History== NACD was founded in 1977 with the goal to educate directors. In 1978 it announced the first comprehensive Director Education Program. Ten years later, NACD recognized the first Director of the Year.{{cite web | publisher = NACD | url =http://www.nacdonline.org/DOY/ | title = NACD Director of the Year |accessdate = 1 July 2012}}{{cite web | publisher = NACD | url =http://www.nacdonline.org/files/FileDownloads/PDF/NACD-Annual-Report-2012.pdf | title = Advancing Exemplary Board Leadership |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} In 1993, NACD published its first Blue Ribbon Commission Report, offering ten principles to guide audit committees and their oversight of the [[financial reporting]] process, as well as risk management and internal and external auditors.{{cite web | publisher = NACD | url =http://www.theiia.org/bookstore/product/report-of-the-nacd-blue-ribbon-commission-on-the-audit-committee-1523.cfm | title = Report of the NACD Blue Ribbon Commission on The Audit Committee |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} In the early 2000s, NACD’s Blue Ribbon Commission Report on Board Evaluations helped optimize board composition, while the organization helped shape [[Sarbanes-Oxley]] and influence the new [[New York Stock Exchange]] (NYSE) & [[NASDAQ]] listing rules. In 2004, NACD co-found the Global Director Development Circle, launched in response to the need to keep directors ahead of international corporate governance and legislation.{{cite web | publisher = Scribd | url =https://www.scribd.com/doc/12751008/The-Global-Director-Development-Circle | title = Global Director Development Circle |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} This program led NACD to globalize the Certificate of Director Education program in 2006. The program has since evolved into the Global Network of Director Institutes.[http://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2013/01/07/514988/10017276/en/NACD-and-Eight-Other-Leading-Corporate-Director-Membership-Organizations-Form- ]{{dead link|date=July 2017}} In 2010, NACD acquired Directorship magazine, a magazine dedicated for today’s corporate officers and [[board of directors]].{{cite web | publisher = NACD | url =http://www.nacdonline.org/files/FileDownloads/PDF/NACD-Annual-Report-2012.pdf | title = Directorship |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} ==Mission== NACD’s mission, as stated on their website, is to advance exemplary board leadership – for directors, by directors by providing the information and insights that board members need to confidently navigate business challenges and enhance shareowner value.{{cite web | publisher = NACD | url =http://www.nacdonline.org/AboutUs/content.cfm?ItemNumber=709&navItemNumber=590 | title = Vision and Mission |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} ==Advocacy== NACD serves as a resource during the legislative process by regularly sending research, publications and comment letters to the [[United States Congress]], the United States Security and Exchange Commission{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/sustained-ethical-corporate-culture-at-risk-from-proposed-sec-whistleblower-rules-112179459.html|title=Sustained Ethical Corporate Culture at Risk From Proposed SEC Whistleblower Rules|first=National Association of Corporate|last=Directors|website=Prnewswire.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/comments/s7-33-10/s73310-135.pdf |title=Request for Comment #6 |website=Sec.gov |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2017-07-10}} and the [[Public Company Accounting Oversight Board]].{{cite web|url=http://pcaobus.org/Rules/Rulemaking/Pages/Docket037Statements.aspx|title=Public Meeting Statements for Docket 037|website=pcaobus.org|accessdate=10 July 2017}}[https://web.archive.org/web/20150618192841/http://pcaobus.org/Rules/Rulemaking/Docket029/038c_NACD.pdf] NACD employees have testified and conferred with key committees as they prepare for Congressional hearings. Research provided by NACD is cited in the legislative and regulatory arenas, providing statistics regarding boards as well as leading practices addressing key issues, such as boardroom compensation.{{cite web | publisher = The Metropolitan Corporate Counsel | url =http://www.metrocorpcounsel.com/articles/19265/nacd-helping-companies-make-better-decisions | title = NACD: Helping Companies Make Better Decisions |accessdate = 1 July 2012}} ==Programs== NACD's programs consists of different director learning and networking opportunities that provide members with resources and reports, as well as encourages members to partake in various professional education classes, peer exchanges and webinars. ===Credentialing (Classes)=== ''NACD Fellowship Programs'': Board members can earn credentials to be considered an NACD Board Leadership Fellow or NACD Governance Fellow by attending NACD Master Class, NACD Director Professionalism courses, Conferences and Forums.{{cite web|url=http://theshareholderactivist.com/shareholder-activism-spotlight/nacd-fellowships-awarded/|title=NACD Fellowships Awarded - The Shareholder Activist|website=theshareholderactivist.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ''Battlefield to Boardroom'': a board development program that prepares and transitions military [[flag officers]] and [[general officers]] from military service to boardroom service and creates employment opportunities for veterans. The Battlefield to Boardroom courses are designed to teach attendees how to serve in the boardroom{{cite web | publisher = NACD | url =http://www.nacdonline.org/battlefieldtoboardroom/index.cfm | title = From Battlefield to Boardroom |accessdate = 10 July 2012}} and provide the opportunity for retired officers currently serving on boards to mentor a new generation of ex-military directors.{{cite web | publisher = Forbes | url =https://www.forbes.com/sites/richardlevick/2012/01/26/from-war-room-to-board-room/ | title = From War Room to Board Room |accessdate = 10 July 2012}} ''Global Board Leaders' Summit'': NACD's annual conference convenes directors, governance leaders and industry experts to help boards identify both opportunities and challenges that could impact a company's strategy and vision.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sAK_QDG4a4|title=YouTube|website=Youtube.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://globenewswire.com/news-release/2014/09/10/665069/10097955/en/White-House-Cybersecurity-Coordinator-to-Give-Keynote-Address-at-NACD-Board-Leadership-Conference.html|title=White House Cybersecurity Coordinator to Give Keynote Address at NACD Board Leadership Conference|website=Globenewswire.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ''NACD Directorship 100'': This annual award recognizes leading corporate directors and governance experts who significantly impact boardroom practices and performance.{{cite web|url=http://www.corpgov.net/2014/07/nacd-directorship-100-released/|title=NACD Directorship 100 Released|date=29 July 2014|website=Corpgov.net|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.redhat.com/en/about/blog/red-hat-director-named-to-nacd-directorship-100|title=Red Hat Director Named to NACD Directorship 100|website=Redhat.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ==Resources== ''NACD Director Compensation Report'': analyzes annual pay levels and practices among 1,400 companies across 24 industries with [[revenue]] from $50 million to more than $10 billion. NACD and Pearl Meyer & Partners annually release the NACD Director Compensation Report.{{cite web | publisher = Forbes | url =https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucerogers/2012/05/15/top-companies-reluctant-to-increase-director-compensation-according-to-new-study-from-national-association-of-corporate-boards/ | title = Top Companies Reluctant to Increase Director Compensation |accessdate = 1 July 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.pearlmeyer.com/2014-15directorcompreport|title=NACD/Pearl Meyer 2016-2017 Director Compensation Report|date=2 August 2016|website=Pearlmeyer.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ''NACD Fortune 500 Committee Chair Advisory Council Briefs'': NACD regularly convenes Fortune 500 board committee chairs, investors, regulators, and leading governance professionals to discuss key issues impacting the audit, compensation, nominating and governance and risk committees.{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/nacd-convenes-nominating-and-governance-committee-chair-advisory-council-to-identify-leading-boardroom-practices-135258503.html|title=NACD Convenes Nominating and Governance Committee Chair Advisory Council to Identify Leading Boardroom Practices|first=National Association of Corporate|last=Directors|website=Prnewswire.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://globenewswire.com/news-release/2013/05/02/543887/10031182/en/NACD-Gathers-Fortune-500-Committee-Chairs-for-Advisory-Council-on-Risk-Oversight.html|title=NACD Gathers Fortune 500 Committee Chairs for Advisory Council on Risk Oversight|first=National Association of Corporate|last=Directors|website=Globalnewswire.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/grp/post/3834048-237726274|title=LinkedIn Groups|website=Linkedin.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ''Annual Governance Surveys'': annual surveys of more than 1,000 public, private and nonprofit directors on leading governance practices.{{cite web|url=http://www.mckinsey.com/insights/leading_in_the_21st_century/ceo_succession_starts_with_developing_your_leaders|title=CEO succession starts with developing your leaders|website=McKinsey & Company|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.heidrick.com/Knowledge-Center/Publication/When-looking-inside-for-your-next-CEO|title=When looking inside for your next CEO|website=Heidrick.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ''NACD Directorship Magazine'': the official magazine of NACD, reporting on current issues of importance to directors and boards.{{cite web|url=http://www.directorship.com|title=NACD Directorship Magazine - NACD Directorship Magazine|website=Directorship.com|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ''NACD Director Handbook Series'': guidance on issues such as cyber-risk oversight, corporate sustainability, effective director onboarding practices and other topics.{{cite web|url=https://www.us-cert.gov/ccubedvp/getting-started-business|title=Resources for Business - US-CERT|website=Us-cert.gov|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ey.com/Publication/vwLUAssets/NACD-EY-taking-sustainability-awareness-to-the-board-level/$FILE/NACD-EY-taking-sustainability-awareness-to-the-board-level.pdf |title=NACD-EY Sustainability Oversight Handbook - Executive Summary_Final.pdf |website=Ey.com |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2017-07-10}} ==Role in the Corporate Governance Movement== In 2001 and 2002, the unexpected bankruptcies of [[Enron]]{{cite web | publisher = Securities and Exchange Commission | url =https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/enron.htm | title =Spotlight on Enron |accessdate = December 3, 2007}} and [[WorldCom]]{{cite web | publisher = Securities and Exchange Commission | url =https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/worldcom.htm | title = Spotlight on SEC v. WorldCom |accessdate = December 3, 2007}} brought increased public and government attention to corporate governance and the role of the [[board of directors]]. In February 2002, Roger Raber, former CEO of NACD, was called to testify before [[House Energy and Commerce Committee]], chaired by Billy Tauzin (R-LA), regarding the failure of Enron Corporation.{{cite web | publisher = The House Committee on Energy and Commerce | url =http://energycommerce.house.gov/reparchives/107/hearings/02062002Hearing483/Raber783.htm | title = Developments Relating to Enron Corp: Prepared Witness Testimony, Roger W. Raber | date = February 6, 2002 |accessdate = December 3, 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071129124130/http://energycommerce.house.gov/reparchives/107/hearings/02062002Hearing483/Raber783.htm |archivedate = November 29, 2007}} At request of Committee, Raber submitted 10 suggested standards, based on the Report of the NACD Blue Ribbon Commission on Director Professionalism (1996/2001/2005), for public company governance, submitting same to the [[New York Stock Exchange]] (NYSE) and the [[NASDAQ]] on May 1, 2002. In November 2003, the [[Securities and Exchange Commission]] approved new listing requirements for both, which were influenced by NACD’s recommendations. The ten core recommendations are as follows:{{cite web | publisher = National Association of Corporate Directors | url =http://www.nacdonline.org/nacd/enron_recommendations.asp | title =Recommendations to Congress |accessdate = December 18, 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20071025181012/http://www.nacdonline.org/nacd/enron_recommendations.asp |archivedate = October 25, 2007}} * Boards should be composed of a substantial majority of [[Non-executive director|independent directors]]. At a minimum, these directors should meet the definition of “independent director” as defined under relevant SRO standards, although boards may consider adopting even more stringent standards of independence. Furthermore, boards should formulate and adhere to clear conflict of interest policies applicable to all board members. * Boards should require that key committees—including but not limited to audit, compensation, and governance/nominating—be composed entirely of independent directors, and are free to hire independent advisors as necessary. * Each key committee should have a board-approved written charter detailing its duties. [[Audit committee]] duties, at a minimum, should include two key elements: a) oversight of the quality and integrity of [[financial reports]] and the process that produces them; b) oversight of the management of risk. Compensation committee duties should include performance goals that align the pay of managers with the long-term interests of shareholders. Governance/nominating committee duties should include setting board and committee performance goals and nominating directors and committee members with the qualifications and time to meet these goals. * Boards should consider formally designating an independent director as chairman or lead director. If they do not make such a designation, they should designate, regardless of title, an independent member to lead the board in its most critical functions, including setting board agendas with the CEO, evaluating CEO and board performance, holding executive sessions, and anticipating and responding to corporate crises. * Boards should regularly and formally evaluate the performance of the CEO, other senior managers, the board as a whole, and individual directors. Independent directors should control the methods and criteria for this evaluation. * Boards should review the adequacy of their companies’ [[Compliance (regulation)|compliance]] and reporting systems at least annually. In particular, boards should ensure that management pays strict attention to ethical behavior and compliance with laws and regulations, approved auditing and accounting principles, and with internal governing documents. In addition to meeting the current requirements for disclosure of management compensation, boards should disclose the total value of each director’s compensation, including the value of any stock options or grants awarded during the year. * Boards should adopt a policy of holding periodic sessions of independent directors only. These meetings should provide board and committee members the opportunity to react to management proposals and/or actions in an environment free from formal or informal constraints. * [[Audit committee]]s should meet independently with both the internal and [[Auditor independence|independent auditors]]. * Boards should be constructively engaged with management to ensure the appropriate development, execution, monitoring, and modification of their companies’ strategies. The nature and extent of the board’s involvement in [[Strategic management|strategy]] will depend on the particular circumstances of the company and the industry or industries in which it is operating. * Boards should provide new directors with a director orientation program to familiarize them with their companies’ business, industry trends, and recommended governance practices. Boards should also ensure that directors are continually updated on these matters. ==NACD and the Securities and Exchange Commission== * 2003-2004 Former NACD CEO Roger Raber and former NACD Chair B. Kenneth West co-signed three letters on Re: File Number S7-19-03 “Security Holder Director Nominations” (34-48626). [https://www.sec.gov/rules/proposed/s71903/nacd122203.htm December 22, 2003]; [https://www.sec.gov/rules/proposed/s71903/nacd030904.htm March 9, 2004]; and [https://www.sec.gov/rules/proposed/s71903/nacd032604.pdf March 26, 2004]. During this time NACD Board member Warren Batts appeared at an [https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/dir-nominations/transcript03102004.txt SEC Roundtable] devoted to the topic. * 2005- 2006 NACD Director Michelle Hooper wrote a letter ([https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/soxcomp/soxcomp-hooper.pdf March 31, 2005]) and participated twice at SEC-PCAOB Roundtables ([https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/soxcomp/soxcomp-trans.txt April 2005] and [https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/soxcomp/mhooper050106.pdf May 2006]) regarding internal control reporting and auditing provisions of Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act. Another NACD Director, the Hon. Barbara Hackman Franklin, has [https://www.sec.gov/spotlight/soxcomp/bhfranklin050306.pdf similarly participated], under her own name, rather than as an NACD representative. * 2009 NACD President and CEO Ken Daly and Chair Barbara Hackman Franklin co-signed a letter to Elizabeth Murphy, Secretary of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, commenting on the proposed rule on proxy disclosure and solicitation enhancements.{{cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/comments/s7-13-09/s71309-94.pdf |title=Microsoft Word - SEC Comment Letter II 091509.doc |website=Sec.gov |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2017-07-10}} * 2011 NACD President and CEO Ken Daly testified before the U.S. House of Representatives Subcommittee on Capital Markets and Government Sponsored Enterprises, commenting on the legislative proposals to address the negative consequences of the Dodd-Frank whistleblower provisions.{{cite web |url=https://www.sec.gov/comments/s7-33-10/s73310-312.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-07-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711084339/https://www.sec.gov/comments/s7-33-10/s73310-312.pdf |archivedate=2015-07-11 |df= }} * 2013 NACD President and CEO Ken Daly and Chair Reatha Clark King co-signed a letter to Elizabeth Murray, Secretary of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, commenting on the proposed rule for pay ratio disclosure, issued by the SEC on September 18, 2013.{{cite web |url=https://www.sec.gov/comments/s7-07-13/s70713-500.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-07-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711093600/https://www.sec.gov/comments/s7-07-13/s70713-500.pdf |archivedate=2015-07-11 |df= }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.nacdonline.org/ National Association of Corporate Directors Homepage] {{DEFAULTSORT:National Association Of Corporate Directors}} [[Category:Business organizations based in the United States]] [[Category:Corporate governance in the United States]] [[Category:1977 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1977]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium - NCOIC | logo = [[Image:NCOIC logo.jpg|center|205px|NCOIC Logo]] | type = Non-Profit | foundation = 2004 | key_people =Harry D. Raduege, <small>Chief Executive Officer</small> | industry = [[Telecommunications]] | homepage = https://www.ncoic.org }} The '''Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium''' (NCOIC) is an international not-for-profit, chartered in the United States, whose goal is to facilitate the adoption of [[cross-domain interoperability]] standards.<ref>Kenyon, H. [http://washingtontechnology.com/articles/2010/09/30/interoperability-efforts-bear-fruit.aspx "NCOIC's efforts toward product interoperability are showing promise"], ''Washington Technology'', 2010</ref> Formed in September 2004, the organization is composed of more than 50 members and advisors representing business, government organizations and academic institutions in 12 countries.<ref>ASDNews, [http://www.asdnews.com/news-1619/Network_Centric_Operations_Industry_Consortium_-NCOIC-_Launch.htm "Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium -NCOIC- Launch"], ''Aerospace & Defense News'', 2004</ref>
NCO is the application of the fundamental tenets of network-centric warfare to aspects of national security, especially industry support for the missions of both the [[United States Department of Defense]] and the [[Department of Homeland Security]] (DHS). NCOIC does not only subscribe to the military use of this theory, but also works to apply NCO and interoperability across nations and industries, including emergency response, health care, [[aerospace]], [[information technology]] cyber security & [[cloud computing]], energy and financial services.
NCOIC’s technical teams have developed resources to further the use of network-centric systems and interoperability in both the public and private sectors. These resources – including processes, tools, frameworks, patterns, principles and databases—are available free of charge on the NCOIC website. They are aimed at helping an organization lower engineering costs, speed program implementation, increase capability and reduce risk. The consortium also provides training and services such as interoperability demonstrations, acquisition strategies, evaluations and verification.
NCOIC focuses on four interdependent areas in identifying solutions that will enable cross-domain interoperability: business, culture, governance and technical. The interaction, influence and impact of factors—such as financial objectives, business goals, laws and regulations, and cultural considerations – are all taken into account when planning and/or implementing technology change.
==Key Technical Resources==
''Systems, Capabilities, Operations, Programs, & Enterprises (SCOPE) Model'' • The SCOPE interoperability assessment model is designed to characterize interoperability-relevant aspects or capabilities of a system or set of systems over a network in terms of a set of dimensions and values along those dimensions.<ref>Richard Creps, Et Al. [https://www.ncoic.org/images/technology/SCOPE_MODEL_VER1.0.pdf "SCOPE"], ''Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium (NCOIC)'', 2008</ref>
''NCOIC Interoperability Framework (NIF)'' • The NIF is a development framework that helps system architects and system engineers to embed interoperability elements throughout the life cycle of programs, beginning with requirements. Whenever possible, those resources are based upon standards.<ref>Mark Bowler. [https://www.ncoic.org/technology/educational-resources/nif-and-net-centric-pattern-overview "NIF"], ''Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium (NCOIC)'', 2008</ref> ''
Net Centric Patterns'' • NCOIC Net Centric Patterns contain prescriptive recommendations on approaches and standards in specific interoperability domains.<ref>Walter Legrand. [https://www.ncoic.org/technology/technical-resources/net-centric-patterns "Netcentric Patterns"], ''Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium (NCOIC)'', 2010</ref>
''Network Centric Analysis Tool (NCAT)'' • NCAT is a collaborative, web-enabled questionnaire-based tool developed to assist NCOIC teams and member companies to enhance the likelihood and reduce the time and effort of member companies developing interoperable systems consistent with customers’ policies and guidelines, reference models and architectures. It is also available in an excel format. <ref>NCOIC. [https://www.ncoic.org/technology/educational-resources/ncat-overview "NCAT"], ''Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium (NCOIC)'', 2010</ref>
''NCOIC QuadTrangle'' • The QuadTrangle™ developed by the Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium shows the four, interdependent areas that must be considered when developing a reliable and trusted interoperable environment: business, culture, governance and technical. <ref>NCOIC. [https://www.ncoic.org/about-us/ncoic-difference/ncoic-quadtrangle "NCOIC QuadTrangle"], ''Network Centric Operations Industry Consortium (NCOIC)'', 2016</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Information technology organizations]] [[Category:Business organizations based in the United States]] [[Category:Net-centric]] [[Category:Organizations established in 2004]]

[[File:45 Pierre Bellanger (15453635376).jpg|thumb|right|Pierre Bellanger, 2014]] <!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Pcb3.jpg|thumb|right|Pierre Bellanger]] --> '''Pierre Bellanger''' (born 1958) is founder and CEO of [[Skyrock (radio)|Skyrock]], a French commercial radio station, and founder of [[skyrock (social network site)|skyrock.com]], a French-language social network.
== Biography == Bellanger created Skyrock in 1985 as a national FM station in France. Today, it ranks as the country's most popular radio station among 13- to 24-year-olds, with four million listeners each day.
As a biology student in late 1970s Paris, Bellanger participated in the [[Pirate radio|free radio]] movement that helped to topple the state's monopoly on broadcasting. Since then, as an entrepreneur in media and Internet, he has created a TV station, several radio stations, as well as numerous cable and satellite services. His interactive experience began in the mid-1980s with the [[Minitel]] and phone services. His first Internet company was created in 1994 as a joint venture with France Telecom.
Bellanger is the author of two books: ''The Future of Radio'' (1992) and ''La convergence, c'est le code''<ref>[http://www.skyrock.fm/bellanger/la_convergence_c_est_le_code.pdf La convergence, c'est le code]</ref> (2003). In 2006, the French Ministry of Culture and Communication named him to the Counsel for Strategic Analysis of Cultural and Communications Industries.
In 2004, Bellanger helped to spearhead the French government's introduction of the Dispositif Alerte-Enlèvement, modeled on the North American [[AMBER Alert]] systems.
== Bibliography == * Pierre Bellanger : ''La radio du futur : Les sept défis de la radio commerciale en France'', [[Armand Colin]], (1992) * Pierre Bellanger : ''Ils ont pensé le futur : web social, marketing, e-commerce...'', KAWA * Pierre Bellanger : ''[https://www.amazon.fr/souverainet%C3%A9-num%C3%A9rique-Pierre-Bellanger/dp/2234077354/ La Souveraineté numérique]'', Éditions Stock
== References == {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.skyrock.fm/bellanger/#english Pierre Bellanger on Social Networks]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bellanger, Pierre}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:French businesspeople]] [[Category:French people of Polish descent]] [[Category:French people of Hungarian descent]] [[Category:Living people]]

[[Image:PerceptualMap3.png|thumb|right|Perceptual map of competing products with ideal vectors]] '''Preference regression''' is a statistical technique used by marketers to determine consumers’ [[Preference|preferred]] core benefits. It usually supplements [[positioning (marketing)|product positioning]] techniques like [[multi dimensional scaling (in marketing)|multi dimensional scaling]] or [[factor analysis]] and is used to create ideal vectors on [[perceptual mapping|perceptual maps]].
==Application== Starting with raw data from surveys, researchers apply positioning techniques to determine important dimensions and plot the position of competing [[product (business)|products]] on these dimensions. Next they [[regression analysis|regress]] the survey data against the dimensions. The independent variables are the data collected in the survey. The dependent variable is the preference datum. Like all regression methods, the computer fits weights to best predict data. The resultant regression line is referred to as an ideal vector because the slope of the vector is the ratio of the preferences for the two dimensions.
If all the data is used in the regression, the program will derive a single equation and hence a single ideal vector. This tends to be a blunt instrument so researchers refine the process with [[cluster analysis (in marketing)|cluster analysis]]. This creates clusters that reflect [[market segment]]s. Separate preference regressions are then done on the data within each segment. This provides an ideal vector for each segment.
==Alternative methods== [[Self-stated importance method]] is an alternative method in which direct survey data is used to determine the weightings rather than statistical imputations. A third method is [[conjoint analysis (marketing)|conjoint analysis]] in which an additive method is used.
==See also== * [[Marketing]] * [[Product management]] * [[Positioning (marketing)]] * [[Marketing research]] * [[Perceptual mapping]] * [[Multidimensional scaling]] * [[Factor analysis]] * [[Linear discriminant analysis#Marketing]] * [[Preference-rank translation]]
==References==
*{{Cite book | last1 = Park | first1 = S. T. | last2 = Chu | first2 = W. | doi = 10.1145/1639714.1639720 | chapter = Pairwise preference regression for cold-start recommendation | title = Proceedings of the third ACM conference on Recommender systems - RecSys '09 | pages = 21 | year = 2009 | isbn = 9781605584355 | pmid = | pmc = }} *Jarboe, G.R.; McDaniel, C.D.; Gates, R.H. (1992). "Preference regression modeling of multiple option healthcare delivery systems". ''Journal of Ambulatory Care Marketing'', 5(1), p.71-82.

{{Refimprove|date=August 2007}}
'''Proteolix, Inc.''', was a private [[biotechnology]] company with headquarters in [[South San Francisco]], [[California]]. Proteolix was founded in 2003 based on technology developed by co-founders [[Craig M. Crews|Dr. Craig Crews]] (Yale University) and Dr. Raymond J. Deshaies (California Institute of Technology). Drs. Susan Molineaux and Phil Whitcome (deceased) joined Drs. Crews and Deshaies as co-founders. Proteolix was launched based on an $18.2 million A round comprising investments by Latterell Venture Partners, US Venture Partners, Advanced Technology Ventures, and The Vertical Group. Proteolix focused primarily on the [[proteasome]] as a therapeutic target. Its lead product candidate, [[carfilzomib]] (PR-171), is a [[tetrapeptide]] [[epoxyketone]]. At the time of its sale (see below), the company had two earlier-stage programs, an orally-bioavailable proteasome inhibitor for oncology (PR-047), and an agent preferentially targeting the immuno form of the proteasome (PR-957), with potential utility in areas such as rheumatoid arthritis. At the time of sale, Carfilzomib's route of administration was [[intravenous]], and the company was exploring its potential utility in [[multiple myeloma]], [[Non-Hodgkin lymphoma]] (NHL) and other cancers.
Proteolix was acquired by [[Onyx Pharmaceuticals]] in 2009 for $810 million (nominal value). Onyx renamed PR-047 to "[https://web.archive.org/web/20110523065128/http://www.onyx-pharm.com/clinical-development/onx-091 ONX 0912]" and PR-957 to "[https://web.archive.org/web/20110523065128/http://www.onyx-pharm.com/clinical-development/onx-091 ONX 0914]".
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20040129224420/http://www.proteolix.com/ Proteolix's corporate website]
{{Med-company-stub}} [[Category:Biotechnology companies of the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in San Mateo County, California]] [[Category:South San Francisco, California]] [[Category:Life sciences industry]]

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person<!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | name = Rajeeb Samdani | image = Rajeeb_Samdani_New.jpg | image_size = 200px | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1974|03|28}} | birth_place = [[Dhaka]], Bangladesh | occupation = Businessman | nationality = Bangladeshi | spouse = Nadia Samdani }}
'''Rajeeb Samdani''' (born 28 March 1974) is a Bangladeshi [[industrialist]]. He is currently the managing director of Golden Harvest Group,<ref>{{cite news |last=Saha |first=Suman |date=1 January 2012 |title=New Year's Resolutions |url=http://www.thedailystar.net/newDesign/news-details.php?nid=216509 |newspaper=The Daily Star}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Golden Harvest takes up $33m expansion plan |url=http://www.newstoday.com.bd/?option=details&news_id=12729&date=2010-11-15 |newspaper=The News Today |date=15 November 2010 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120904135240/http://www.newstoday.com.bd/?option=details&news_id=12729&date=2010-11-15 |archive-date=4 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> a leading Bangladeshi conglomerate,<ref>[http://www.bdreports24.com/airtel-signs-corporate-deal-golden-harvest/]. ''bdreports''. 10 December 2013.</ref> and the founder and trustee of [[Samdani Art Foundation]] which produces the [[Dhaka Art Summit]].<ref>[http://www.thedailystar.net/newDesign/news-details.php?nid=221344 Master strokes Dhaka Art Summit in April]. ''The Daily Star''. 7 February 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.thewallartmag.com/Article/Dhaka-Art-Summit---a-beginning--62 Dhaka Art Summit – a beginning!]. The Wall, 6 May 2012</ref> He is the founding committee member and co-chair of the Tate Museum, United Kingdom, South Asian Acquisition Committee.<ref>[http://www.thedailystar.net/newDesign/news-details.php?nid=256083 Bangladeshi Rajeeb Samdani appointed founding member]. ''The Daily Star''. 7 November 2012.</ref> Rajeeb and his wife Nadia Samdani are members of Tate's International Council and founding members of Harvard University Lakshmi Mittal South Asia Institute's Arts Advisory Council, USA.<ref>[http://southasiainstitute.harvard.edu/2015/12/sai-forms-arts-advisory-council/]. ''Harvard University South Asian Arts Council'' 9 December 2015</ref> They are also members of Alserkal Avenue Programming Committee, Dubai and advisory council members of Art Dubai.<ref>[http://www.abudhabicityinfo.com/news/pr_Alserkal_Avenue_Announces_New_Homegrown_Programme_Featuring.aspx]</ref><ref>[http://www.artdubai.ae/committees/]</ref>
== Career == He started his career as a commodity broker with Stemcor. Over the years, his company, Golden Harvest, expanded its business into information technology, commodities, logistics, food processing, agriculture, dairy, aviation, insurance, banking, infrastructure development and real estate.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rajeeb Samdani |url=http://archive.thedailystar.net/suppliments/2012/anniversary_2012/section3/pf7.htm |work=21 Anniversary Supplement |publisher=The Daily Star |date=2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Shah |first=Gayatri Rangachari |date=4 December 2013 |title=Putting Bangladesh on the Arts Map |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/12/05/arts/international/putting-bangladesh-on-the-arts-map.html?_r=0 |newspaper=The New York Times}}</ref><ref>[http://www.bangladeshbrandforum.com/magazine/112013/brand_news_local.php Grey Advertising Bangladesh Limited was Assigned as a Creative Agency of Golden Harvest Ice-cream]. Bangladesh Brand Forum November 2013</ref><ref>[http://www.thefinancialexpress-bd.com/old/index.php?ref=MjBfMDVfMjlfMTNfMV84OV8xNzA5NjA= STOCK & CORPORATE]. The Financial Express. 29 May 2013</ref><ref>[http://www.newstoday.com.bd/?option=details&news_id=2346245&date=2013-05-29]. The News Today.</ref> He is also the chairman of Dubai-based financial institution Gulf International Finance Limited.<ref>[http://gifl.org/]</ref>
Golden Harvest has expanded business into logistics industry with its Japanese partner [[Nippon Express]], the largest logistic company in Asia and the fifth largest logistic company in the world.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nippon Express sets foot in Bangladesh |url=http://www.thedailystar.net/newDesign/news-details.php?nid=230702 |newspaper=The Daily Star |date=19 April 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Nippon Express arranges opening ceremony |url=http://www.thefinancialexpress-bd.com/more.php?news_id=127161&date=2012-04-19 |newspaper=The Financial Express |location=Dhaka |date=19 April 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Nippon Express vows better service in logistics sector |url=http://www.newstoday.com.bd/index.php?option=details&news_id=2310266&date=2012-04-19 |newspaper=News Today |date=19 April 2012 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120904044236/http://www.newstoday.com.bd/index.php?option=details&news_id=2310266&date=2012-04-19 |archive-date=4 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
== Personal life == He is married to Nadia Samdani who is the president of Samdani Art Foundation and co-founder and director of the Dhaka Art Summit.<ref>[http://www.popxo.com/2014/02/6-reasons-we-loved-the-dhaka-art-summit-this-year-nadia-samdani-summarises-the-vibrant-art-fest/ 4 Reasons We Loved The Dhaka Art Summit This Year: A Pictoral Journey!] POPXO 26 February 2014</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Chatak |first=Hasan Mansoor |date=8 February 2014 |title=Dhaka Art Summit 2014 takes off |url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/entertainment/2014/feb/08/dhaka-art-summit-2014-takes |newspaper=Dhaka Tribune}}</ref> They have three daughters: Radyna, Alvina and Maya.<ref>[http://hellopakistanmag.com/hello-pakistan/the-creatives-behind-dhaka-art-summit/]</ref> The collector couple is well known for their local and international art collection as well as their art philanthropy.<ref>[http://indianexpress.com/article/opinion/columns/art-destination-dhaka/ Art destination Dhaka]. ''The Indian Express''. 18 February 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ani/art-summit-in-bangladesh-showcases-works-of-south-asian-artists-114021000758_1.html Art summit in Bangladesh showcases works of South Asian artists]. ''Business Standard''. 10 February 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.dnaindia.com/lifestyle/column-nadia-and-rajeeb-samdani-1945683 Nadia and Rajeeb Samdani] dna 5 January 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/dXvDOJGzEtAeZxcJP3McwI/Art-in-the-air.html Art in the air]. livemint. 31 January 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.theartnewspaper.com/articles/Dhaka-Art-Summit-dont-call-it-an-art-fair/31373 Dhaka Art Summit: don’t call it an art fair]. ''The Art News Paper''. 23 December 2013</ref>
== Philanthropy ==
He is the trustee and [[secretary general]] of the Bangladesh Human Rights Foundation, founder of the Alvina Samdani Trust & Taher Ahmed Choudhury Charitable Hospital. Along with his wife Nadia Samdani, Rajeeb Samdani collects artworks from all over the world and has over 2000 modern and contemporary art.<ref>[https://museumnetwork.sothebys.com/article/breaking-new-ground-for-contemporary-art-in-bangladesh Breaking New Ground for Contemporary Art in Bangladesh] ''Sothebys'', 6 February 2018</ref>
[[Samdani Art Foundation]] was established in 2011 by Rajeeb Samdani and his wife Nadia Samdani.<ref>[https://independent-collectors.com/interviews/nadia-rajeeb-samdani-dhaka-art-summit/ Nadia and Rajeeb Samdani] ''Independent Collectors'', 29 January 2018</ref> The foundation is based in Dhaka, Bangladesh and supports country’s contemporary art and architecture.<ref>[https://frieze.com/article/how-see-somewhere-else-4th-dhaka-art-summit How to See from Somewhere Else – the 4th Dhaka Art Summit] Frieze, 12 February 2018</ref> The [[Samdani Art Foundation]] is a donor for the 56th International Biennale di Venezia, supporting the projects of artists [[Naeem Mohaiemen]] and Raqs Media Collective in the main Biennale exhibition:All the World’s Futures.<ref>[http://samdani.com.bd/assets/Uploads/TheArtNewsPaper-01.05.15.pdf] The Art Newspaper</ref><ref>[http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/c08e31f2-ea66-11e4-96ec-00144feab7de,Authorised=false.html?_i_location=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ft.com%2Fcms%2Fs%2F0%2Fc08e31f2-ea66-11e4-96ec-00144feab7de.html%3Fdesktop%3Dtrue%26siteedition%3Dintl&siteedition=intl&desktop=true&_i_referer=http%3A%2F%2Fmail.samdani.com.bd%2Findex.php%2Fsrc%2Fread_body.php%3Fmailbox%3DINBOX%26passed_id%3D1234%26startMessage%3D1#axzz3Z3LeojZl] Financial Times</ref><ref>[http://www.larryslist.com/artmarket/features/10-art-collectors-you-probably-didnt-know-were-involved-in-the-56th-venice-biennale/ 5 Art Collectors You Probably Didn’t Know Were Involved In The 56th Venice Biennale] Larry's list</ref> Through the Samdani Art Foundation, he funded the [[Kunsthalle Basel]]'s first exhibition of a South Asian artist, Naeem Mohaiemen in 2014.<ref>[http://www.kunsthallebasel.ch/en/exhibition/prisoners-of-shothik-itihash/ Prisoner of Shothik Itihash]''Kunsthalle Basel''</ref> Bangladeshi-British artist Rana Begum’s first major institutional solo exhibition at Parasol Unit, London was also supported through Samdani Art Foundation in 2016.<ref>[http://parasol-unit.org/whats-on/rana-begum-space/ Rana Begum: The Space Between] ''Parasol Unit''</ref> They also support Bangladeshi artists to produce works for exhibitions. Some of the supported exhibitions are the Kochi Muziris Biennale 2014, Shanghai Biennale 2016, Speak Lokal, Kunsthalle, Zurich,etc.<ref>[http://kochimuzirisbiennale.org/project-support/ Artist Project Support] kochimuzirisbiennale</ref><ref>[http://www.shanghaibiennale.org/en/organization/showlist.html]</ref><ref>[http://kunsthallezurich.ch/en/speak-lokal Speak Lokal] ''Kunsthalle Zurich''</ref> The foundation supports emerging artists and architects with the biannual Samdani Art and Samdani Architecture awards. <ref>[https://www.harpersbazaararabia.com/art/news/bangladeshi-artist-wins-samdani-art-award Bangladeshi Mizanur Rahman Chowdhury Wins Samdani Art Award] ''Harpers Bazaar Arabia'', 4 February 2018</ref><ref>[https://www.thedailystar.net/arts-entertainment/event/bangladeshi-art-and-architecture-go-global-1529416 Bangladeshi Art and Architecture Go Global]''The Daily Star'', 4 February 2018</ref><ref>[https://www.thedailystar.net/lifestyle/news-flash/samdani-architecture-award-winner-announced-1464085 Samdani Architecture Award Winner Announced] ''The Daily Star'', 19 September 2018</ref> Another program of the foundation, The Samdani Artist-Led Initiatives Forum launched on April 13, 2017 supports the work of Bangladesh’s independently established and self-funded art collectives and initiatives.<ref>[https://theartling.com/en/artzine/2018/02/05/re-examinations-on-the-function-of-art-dhaka-art-summit-2018/ Re-Examinations on the Function of Art: Dhaka Art Summit 2018]''The Artling'', 5 February 2018</ref>
The Samdanis have organised the [[Dhaka Art Summit]], a non-profit event funded by Samdani Art Foundation from 2012.<ref>[http://in.artinfo.com/news/story/780050/dhaka-to-host-bangladesh%E2%80%99s-first-art-summit Dhaka to Host Bangladesh’s First Art Summit] Boulin Art Info 22 March 2012</ref><ref>[https://blogs.wsj.com/indiarealtime/2012/04/10/bangladesh-strives-to-be-the-new-india-of-art/?mod=google_news_blog Bangladesh Strives to be the New ‘India’ of Art]. ''The Wall Street Journal''. 10 April 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.timescrest.com/culture/taka-art-summit-7673 Taka Art Summit]. ''The Times of India'', 7 April 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.dnaindia.com/lifestyle/column-dhaka-art-summit-1962406 Dhaka Art Summit]. dna 16 February 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.thedailystar.net/shout/where-lines-went-for-walks-10877 WHERE LINES WENT FOR WALKS]. ''The Daily Star''. 13 February 2014</ref><ref>[http://art-agenda.com/reviews/dispatch-dhaka-art-summit/ Dispatch: Dhaka Art Summit] art agenda 27 February 2014</ref><ref>[http://www.sunday-guardian.com/artbeat/lady-gaga-to-perform-in-outer-space Second Dhaka Art Summit announced]. ''The Sunday Guardian''. 9 November 2013</ref><ref>[http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/personal-finance/art/samdani-art-foundation-to-stage-second-edition-of-dhaka-art-summit/articleshow/25268705.cms Samdani Art Foundation to stage second edition of Dhaka Art Summit]. ''The Economic Times'' 5 November 2013</ref> [[Dhaka Art Summit]] takes place in every two years at the Bangladesh Shilpakala Academy in collaboration with the Ministry of Cultural Affairs, People’s Republic of Bangladesh and considered to be the largest South Asian art event.<ref>[https://www.dhakatribune.com/opinion/special/2018/02/01/dhaka-art-summit-cultural-capital-south-asia/ Dhaka (Art Summit): The cultural capital of South Asia]''Dhaka Tribune'', 1 February 2018</ref><ref>[http://www.saatsaatharts.org/dhaka-art-summit-2016]''Saat Saath Arts''</ref><ref>[ https://gulfnews.com/culture/arts/300-artists-10-exhibitions-at-dhaka-art-summit-1.2166088#.WnMO1lTH-wI.hotmail]</ref> The 4th edition of the Dhaka Art Summit took place from 2 to 10 February 2018 with footfall of 3,17,000, among them were 1200 international visitors, including the President of Switzerland, Mr. Alain Berset.<ref>[https://www.thedailystar.net/backpage/swiss-president-arrives-today-4-day-visit-1529557 Swiss President Visits Dhaka for 4 Day Visit]''The Daily Star'', 4 February 2018</ref><ref>[https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/foreign-affairs/2018/02/04/swiss-president-dhaka/]</ref><ref>[https://ocula.com/magazine/reports/into-the-blue--dhaka-art-summit-2018/ Into the Blue]''Ocula'',23 February 2018</ref>
Their new initiative is the Srihatta—Samdani Art Centre and Sculpture Park, which is the forthcoming permanent art space established under the Samdani Art Foundation.<ref>[http://thepeakmagazine.com.sg/lifestyle/billionaire-couple-started-dhaka-art-summit-bring-bangladesh-international-arts-scene/]</ref> Srihatta will be the first permanent dedicated space for the Foundation’s programming and exhibition activities, featuring an ongoing schedule of exhibitions curated by [[Diana Campbell Betancourt]].<ref>[https://conversations.e-flux.com/t/you-don-t-grow-without-being-self-critical-a-conversation-with-diana-campbell-betancourt/7895]</ref> The centre is designed by Kashef Mahboob Chowdhury, who won the Agha Khan Award in 2016. This is also the country’s first sculpture park and dedicated art space for international modern and contemporary art.<ref>[http://www.artnews.com/2017/05/12/samdani-art-foundation-unveils-plans-and-announces-programming-for-first-permanent-space/]</ref>
==Acknowledgement==
The Samdanis have received several awards for their philanthropy. They were the first and only South Asians to receive the Montblanc de la Culture Arts Patronage award in 2017 and were recognized on the Top 200 Collectors list by Artnews in 2015, 2016 and 2017, the Power 100 list in 2015, 2016 and 2017 by Art Review and The World's Top 100 Art Collectors 2016 by ArtNet News.<ref>[https://www.harpersbazaararabia.com/art/news/montblanc-de-la-culture-arts-patronage-award-presented-in-dubai]</ref><ref>[http://www.artnews.com/top200year/2015/ 2015 TOP 200 COLLECTORS]</ref><ref>[http://artreview.com/power_100/nadia_rajeeb_samdani]</ref><ref>[https://news.artnet.com/art-world/worlds-top-100-art-collectors-part-two-513953]. ''ArtNet News''. 15 June 2016.</ref><ref>[https://artreview.com/power_100/]</ref><ref>[https://artreview.com/power_100/nadia_rajeeb_samdani/ Power 100]''ArtReview''</ref> The couple have been invited to various international institutions to speak, including University of California, Bekerly, USA.<ref>[http://events.berkeley.edu/index.php/calendar/sn/sseas.html?event_ID=116608&date=2018-04-27]</ref> Artworks from their collection has travelled to major exhibitions, such as documenta 14 (2017); Shanghai Biennale (2017); Office for Contemporary Art, Norway (2016); Centre Pompidou, Paris (2015); Kunstsammlung Nordhrhein, Düsseldorf (2016); Gwangju Biennale, South Korea (2014); Kochi-Muziris Biennale, India (2014).<ref>[http://www.documenta14.de/en/artists/13547/lala-rukh]</ref><ref>[https://www.oca.no/programme/notations/the-missing-one.1]</ref><ref>[http://kochimuzirisbiennale.org/project-support/]</ref>
== References == {{Reflist|35em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Samdani, Rajeeb}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bangladeshi businesspeople]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Sani Sener | image = Sani Sener.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1955}} | birth_place = [[Trabzon]], Turkey | birth_name = Sani Sener | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = <!-- {{Coord|LAT|LONG|display=inline}} --> | residence = Istanbul | nationality = Turkish | other_names = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | occupation = Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer | years_active = | employer = | organization = [http://www.tavhavalimanlari.com.tr/en-EN/Pages/Main.aspx TAV Airports Holding] and [http://www.tavconstruction.com/ TAV Construction] | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = | height = | weight = | title = | term = | opponents = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | callsign = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | signature_size = | module = | website = | footnotes = | box_width = }}
'''Dr. Engineer Mustafa Sani Şener''' (born February 14, 1955) is a Turkish construction magnate. He is co-founder and chief executive officer of TAV Airports Holding and TAV Construction.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://enr.construction.com/toplists/InternationalContractors/101-200.asp |title=The Top 225 International Contractors}}</ref>
==Early years== Sani Şener was born in Trabzon, Turkey, as the third and last child of prominent Turkish bureaucrat and politician Ahmet Şener (1921–1991) and Feride Şener (née Külür). Sani has one older brother, [[Sadri Şener]] and an older sister, [[Sezer Şener Komsuoğlu|Prof. Dr Sezer Şener Komsuoğlu]].
Şener had his mechanical engineering degree in 1977 at the Black Sea Technical University. He holds an M.Phil degree in Engineering from the University of Sussex in the United Kingdom. He received his doctorate degree from the Black Sea Technical University in acknowledgement of his distinguished contribution in the infrastructure development projects of Turkey. He also received training on management of complex systems at the [http://web.mit.edu/ Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)]).
==Career== Sani Şener managed and led many development projects ranging from dam construction to housing complexes; from hospitals, universities, airports, highways, trade centers, tunnels to power plants in Turkey and abroad since 1979.
Sani Şener is best known for his leadership in design, construction, financing and operation of the [http://www.ataturkairport.com/en-EN/Pages/Main.aspx Istanbul Atatürk Airport]’s international terminal building and its side facilities project in 1997. Under his leadership, [http://www.tavhavalimanlari.com.tr/en-EN/Pages/Main.aspx TAV Airports] was founded as a joint-stock company for Istanbul Atatürk Airport’s 500 thousand m2 of construction and operation project which was one of the first major airport Build-Operate-Transfer (BOT) projects in the world. The construction of the colossal project was complete in only 22 months, 8 months ahead of schedule.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tavconstruction.com/tav/Projects/Aviation---Airports/Completed-Projects/istnbul-ataturk-international-airport.aspx|title=Istanbul Ataturk International Airport|author=|date=|work=TAV Construction|publisher=TAV Tepe Akfen Investment Construction and Operation JSC|accessdate=3 October 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118002132/http://www.tavconstruction.com/tav/Projects/Aviation---Airports/Completed-Projects/istnbul-ataturk-international-airport.aspx|archivedate=18 January 2012|df=}}</ref>
Since the beginning of Istanbul Atatürk Airport project, Sani Şener has been the chief executive officer of TAV Airports Company, which has fast evolved into an airport construction and operation holding group that manages 13 airports and 24 airport related subsidiary companies as of March, 2017.
'''Airports that are operated by TAV group are:'''
[[Istanbul Atatürk Airport]], Ankara [[Esenboğa International Airport]], Izmir [[Adnan Menderes Airport]], Antalya [[Gazipaşa Airport]] and [[Milas–Bodrum Airport]] in Turkey;
[[Monastir Habib Bourguiba International Airport]] and [[Enfidha–Hammamet International Airport]] in Tunisia,
[[Tbilisi International Airport]] and [[Batumi International Airport]] in the Republic of Georgia;
[[Skopje "Alexander the Great" Airport]] and [[Ohrid "St. Paul the Apostle" Airport]] in the Republic of Macedonia;
Medina [[Prince Mohammad bin Abdulaziz Airport]] in Saudi Arabia
[[Zagreb Airport]] in Croatia.
==Awards and honors== In 2010, Şener was selected the “Investor Relations CEO of the Year in Turkey” by Thomson Reuters and Acclaro.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.irawards.eu/final/ira2010/ira10_winners.html|title=Winners|author= |date=3 October 2011 |work=Investor Relations Awards 2011|publisher= |accessdate=3 October 2011}}</ref>
Şener became the head of the Turkish-French Business Council at Foreign Economic Relations Board in 2012.<ref>http://www.turkishpress.com/news.asp?id=382896</ref>
Sani Şener represents the European region at [[Airports Council International]] World Governing Board –the global industrial body of world’s airports.<ref>http://www.ftnnews.com/news-home/appointments/28--turkey-appointments/22375-tav-ceo-selected-to-aci-world-governing-board.html</ref>
Şener received the "Industry Hero" award at the Global Airport Development Conference held in Nice, France in 2013. The award was to honor his outstanding performance for keeping TAV Airports' strategy and vision intact during turbulent times in the aviation industry.<ref>http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkish-ceo-takes-big-leadership-prize.aspx?pageID=238&nID=57555&NewsCatID=345</ref>
Sani Şener was presented with the Georgian State Medal of Distinguished Service in 2016 by the Prime Minister [[Giorgi Kvirikashvili]], for his contributions to the development of the country.<ref>http://ftnnews.com/news-from-turkey/30371-tav-breaks-ground-on-new-tbilisi-airport-terminal.html</ref>
In 2016, Sani Şener received the [[Legion d'honneur]] of the Chevalier order by France in recognition of his remarkable contributions to development of the Turkish-French bilateral relations.<ref>http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/tav-ceo-honored-with-frances-highest-honor.aspx?pageID=238&nID=105763&NewsCatID=345</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Sener, Sani}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Turkish businesspeople]]
